meanings.definition: A shallow, flat container for serving food.
meanings.sent1: She placed the pasta in a colorful dish.
meanings.sent2: The waiter brought out a dish of steaming soup.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over the dish, spilling its contents everywhere.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a dish of sunshine on a rainy day.
meanings.sent5: The dish gleamed under the bright kitchen lights.

meanings.definition: A particular variety or preparation of food.
meanings.sent1: The restaurant's specialty dish was a spicy curry.
meanings.sent2: I love trying new dishes when I travel.
meanings.sent3: The dish of cookies disappeared in minutes at the party.
meanings.sent4: His storytelling was a delicious dish for the ears.
meanings.sent5: The dish of sushi was beautifully presented on the plate.

meanings.definition: To serve food in a dish.
meanings.sent1: She will dish out the soup into bowls for everyone.
meanings.sent2: The chef dished the pasta onto the plates with precision.
meanings.sent3: He dished out compliments as easily as he dished out food.
meanings.sent4: The speaker dished out wisdom to the eager audience.
meanings.sent5: The mother dished out love along with the warm meal.

meanings.sent1: The group of friends liked to dish about their classmates.
meanings.sent2: She dished the latest news to anyone who would listen.
meanings.sent3: The neighbors would often dish over the fence about each other.
meanings.sent4: The tabloids dished out scandalous stories about celebrities.
meanings.sent5: The internet is a place where people can dish anonymously.
